result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Lee Eddy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases called: 14CF284 & 14CF296, Defendant Justin Lee Eddy in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim notification complied with Parties have received PSI, no corrections. Sentencing statements made. Court sentenced defendant to 12 months year jail in 14CF284. In 14CF296 to 9 months, consecutive to 14CF284 sentence. Huber granted under jail rules. May transfer to Rock County Jail. Unpaid financials converted to civil judgment. In 14CF284, 266 days jail credit. In 14CF296, 55 days jail credit. 10:40 am, 11:10 a.m.

Defendant Justin Lee Eddy in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called:  14CF284 & 14CF296.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1 in 14CF284 and to Ct. 1 in 14CF296.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  In both cases Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 3 years each case.  $518.00 costs each count.  Anger management counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit DNA sample.  Dismiss but read in Ct. 2 on both cases.   Jail credit on 14CF284 6 days,  in 14CF296 55 days credit.  Bond in 14CF284 to be applied towards costs.
Bail/bond hearing on August 27, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
